senses.sense_definition: A surname, most notably associated with Peter Mark Roget, the creator of the thesaurus.

examples.text: Peter Mark <w>Roget</w> published the first edition of his thesaurus in 1852.
The <w>Roget</w> family has a long history of intellectual achievement.

senses.sense_definition: To use a thesaurus to look for or suggest synonyms for words.

examples.text: She sat at her desk <w>Rogeting</w> furiously to find a better word for "happy".
There is no point in <w>Rogeting</w> every simple term if the meaning becomes obscure.

senses.sense_definition: To replace words in a text with synonyms, often mechanically, in order to disguise plagiarism.

examples.text: The professor realized the student had been <w>Rogeting</w> the essay when the sentences stopped making sense.
Software tools can now detect when a paper has been <w>Rogeted</w> to hide its original source.
